doc:
Reginald de Veulle https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reginald_de_Veulle 0 Raoul Reginald "Reggie" de Veulle (c. 1881–1956), was a British actor and fashion costumier. He was the son of a former British vice-consul at Le Mans and was born there, but raised in Jersey. He attended the Kensington School of Art and though he acted in a few West End shows, moved into fashion design. He is associated with the death of the actress Billie Carleton in 1918, and was convicted of supplying drugs to her, but was acquitted of her manslaughter. Raoul_Reginald_"_Reggie " de Veulle ( c. 1881 – 1956 ) , was a_British_actor_and_fashion_costumier . He was the_son of a_former_British_vice-consul at Le_Mans and was_born there , but raised in Jersey . He attended the_Kensington_School of Art and though he acted in a_few_West_End shows , moved into fashion_design . He is_associated with the_death of the_actress_Billie_Carleton in 1918 , and was_convicted of supplying drugs to her , but was_acquitted of her_manslaughter .
